question_text: The structures of the African Union includes
subject: government

options.answer: the court of justice, pan African congress and peolpe's Assembly
pan African parliament, the court of justice and the peace and security conucil
sepcialized Technical commission, the court of justice and humanitarian board
people's Assembly, Humanitarian Board and the peace and security council

question_text: The African leader mostly credited for spearheading the formation of the African Union is
subject: government
explanation: The Organisation of African Unity (OAU) or Organisation de l'Unit√© Africaine (OUA) was established on May 25, 1963. It was disbanded on July 9, 2002 by its last chairperson, South African President Thabo Mbeki and replaced by the African Union. Frustration at its ineffectiveness led African leaders, spearheaded by Libyan leader Muammar el-Qaddafi, to launch the African Union, a body with a structure modeled on that of the European Union. Fifty-three countries in Africa are members of the AU.
